title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 January 2017 - XWiki
content: has quit 02:27  has quit 02:28  has joined #xwiki 02:29  has joined #xwiki 06:49  has joined #xwiki 07:30  has joined #xwiki 08:06  has joined #xwiki 08:12  has quit 08:41  has joined #xwiki 08:41  has quit 09:12  has joined #xwiki 09:27  has joined #xwiki 09:39  has joined #xwiki 09:58  has joined #xwiki 10:04  has joined #xwiki 10:12  has joined #xwiki 10:24  has joined #xwiki 10:37  has quit 10:40  has joined #xwiki 10:46  has quit 11:06  tmortagne, vmassol: do you know if the \*\*plain\*\* XWiki 2.1 syntax can generate any of the following HTML elements: 11:06  abbr acronym address b base big body button caption cite code dfn fieldset form head html i input kbd label legend link meta noscript object optgroup option param q samp script select small style textarea title var 11:06  I checked the XHTML renderer and I couldn't find these, but maybe I missed something 11:08  I don't think any of those can be generated without html macro 11:09  has joined #xwiki 11:09  we do have bold and italic but not done using i and b 11:09  yes, excluding HTML macro 11:10  I want to configure CKEditor's Advanced Content Filter for XWiki 2.1 syntax so that the editor features that generate unsupported elements are disabled automatically 11:11  i.e. if the current syntax (XWiki 2.1) doesn't support table caption then the editor should disable this feature 11:12  I'll start with the list I have and we can fine-tune it later if I missed something 11:16  it's not the same 11:16  you can't generate b with xwiki/2.1 syntax but pretty sure the xhtml parser will produce bold event for b 11:17  in the end you will end up with string in the produced html sure but I doubt anyone will complain 11:17  s/string/strong/ 11:17  so what you should look at is xhtml parser, not the renderer 11:19  I'll do that, thanks 11:20  now except for i and b I doubt the parser support the other elements) 11:20  small too 11:22  another aproach is list the stuff that are not supported and support then when all it takes is to find some style that would more or less match the expected result, like in case of abbr 11:22  we can't do anything about form and stuff like this 12:00  has quit 12:19  has quit 12:23  has joined #xwiki 12:24  hello, what is this "Office Server"? Never heard of that 12:24  is that a headless libreoffice or openoffice server? 12:45  ok, I guess it is for an openoffice server 12:45  can I also use libreoffice? 12:47  Aison: we mostly use that with libreofice since a while now 12:49  the setup talk about openoffice because libreoofice did not existed back then but that part is working the same without OO or LO 12:49  s/without/with/ 12:56  tmortagne, ok, nice, works with libreoffice :-) 13:07  OO is pretty much dead anyway (they reached the point where they are discussing if they should give the ownership to Document Foundation, i.e. LibreOffice) 13:41  has joined #xwiki 14:11  has quit 14:22  has joined #xwiki 14:22  has quit 14:23  Hello 14:23  someone knows how i can export all my xwiki in html standalone website ? 14:24  because when i select export in admin menu i can't export all page 14:24  only the current page is available 14:24  ?? 14:28  try /xwiki/bin/export/Main/WebHome?format=html&pages=%25 14:28  but it will take a huge time to perform 14:29  i will try now 14:29  ! 14:30  I haven't tried it myself because I don't have a running wiki right now 14:30  tell me if it works 14:30  has joined #xwiki 14:31  unfortunaly no 14:31  it redirect me to /xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?section=MessageStream 14:32  and i didnt see any doawloded files 14:35  has joined #xwiki 14:36  try /xwiki/bin/export/Main/WebHome?format=html&pages=wikiname:%25.%25 ? 14:38  has joined #xwiki 14:40  this command download a backup.xar file 14:41  but i don't see something like index.html  ... 14:42  I dont sure about my wikiname token 14:43  but I don't understand why you are redirected 14:43  what is the URL that you type? 14:44  just to be sure .. wikiname is for exemple "Sandbox"  available on default xwiki installation ? 14:45  the first Url who redirect me was : http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/export/Main/WebHome?format=html&pages=%25 14:45  it's a wiki test that running in localhost 14:51  are you redirected with http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome 14:51  ? 14:52  one issue you might have is that the html export works by executing all the pages so if you have any page which some script calling sendRedirect it will redirect you 14:53  your last url send me on my dashboad 14:54  no redirection i think 14:57  are you redirected with http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/export/Main/WebHome?format=html&pages=Main.WebHome ? 14:58  No its okay 14:58  yes so I think you have one page in our wiki which tellthe browser to redirect 14:59  when the html export execute that page the browser is redirected before you receive the result 15:00  arf ... 15:01  the html exported need to isolate itself better... 15:01  \*exporter 15:02  the offcial doc says to use ServerName/xwiki/bin/export/WikiSpace/WikiPage?format=html&pages=wikiid:pageFullNamePattern 15:02  maybe this one will work 15:02  yes and the official doc is right but this is for a specific page not the whole wiki use case 15:03  that's the link I gave you which export only the home page for example 15:03  %25 matches all the pages 15:03  ha okay 15:04  (it end up as % used in a SQL LIKE) 15:05  and for all page for a subwiki 15:05  like sandbox wiki for exmple 15:06  sandbox:%25 15:07  sandbox%3A%25 actually since : need to be encoded in URL 15:07  basically it means all the document names sandbox: 15:08  hmm no 15:08  sorry 15:08  you have to execute the request with %25 in the wiki sandbox actualy 15:08  the html export only look at current wiki 15:08  so %25 is all pages in current wiki 15:08  i place me on http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/ 15:09  that's sandbox space 15:09  not a different wiki 15:09  so Sandox.%25 15:10  different wiki is http://extensions.xwiki.org vs http://www.xwiki.org for example 15:10  http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/?format=html&pages=Sandbox:%25 15:10  no 15:10  something like that ? 15:10  http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/?format=html&pages=Sandbox.%25 15:10  you don't need to be in Sanbox space when you execute that 15:11  you indicate what you want to export with the pages parameter anyway 15:13  humm i have something that i dont understand 15:13  because 15:13  this url -> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?format=html&pages=Sandbox.%25 15:13  download me nothing 15:13  gnarkkk 15:14  export 15:14  instead of /view/ 15:14  http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/export/Main/?format=html&pages=Sandbox.%25 15:14  you are not using the right action 15:14  I did not noticed 15:16  YES , with /export/ instead of /view/ this is better 15:16  ! 15:17  i have a folder with  all subpage from Sandbox wiki 15:18  do you know if there is an option for set in my new html files 15:18  bevause by default the export keep localhost:80 for link 15:21  has quit 15:28  not "Sandbox wiki", "Sandbox space" 15:28  ok syntax error ! 15:28  "bevause by default the export keep localhost:80 for link" not exactly, it keep pull URL only for pages you did not exported 15:28  others get relative link 15:29  s/pull/full/ 15:31  hummm 15:31  in my html file 15:31  i have 15:31  Sandbox Test Page 1 15:31  that's weird 15:32  what version of XWiki is this ? 15:32  XWiki Enterprise 7.4.5 15:32  its a free demo xwiki maybe all features are not available 15:35  looks like a bug 15:35  I reproduce it on 7.4.5 too 15:35  rafff its not my lucky day ! 15:36  it's not the most used feature so we don't know about regression very fast when there is 15:36  it used to work for sure 15:36  but did not tried it since a very long time 15:36  reporting the bug 15:37  are you a Xwiki team member ? 15:37  or maintener ? 15:40  created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13976 15:40  I'm a XWiki Team member yes 15:40  but not the one who worked on html export latest changes so I did not followed it closely 15:42  do you know if the feature work with another Xwiki version ? 15:43  this used to work yes in older version but cannot tell you in which version it was broken sorry 15:44  OK 15:44  je viens de voir que tu étais français 15:45  je m'en serai mieux sorti en français ! 15:51  yes but the thing is we talk in english because this chat is archived and people can find answers in it 15:51  Yes yes .. 15:51  le français a perdu le concour de la lingua franca :) 15:53  Thank you for your help 15:55  in the worst case i will write a script for set all href with good relative url 16:03  thank you again 16:03  bye 16:06  has quit 16:15  has joined #xwiki 16:17  has quit 16:17  is now known as 16:19  has quit 16:19  has quit 16:19  has quit 16:19  has quit 16:19  has quit 16:20  has joined #xwiki 16:22  has joined #xwiki 16:22  has joined #xwiki 16:23  has joined #xwiki 17:09  has quit 17:19  has quit 17:21  has joined #xwiki 17:52  has quit 17:52  has joined #xwiki 18:31  has joined #xwiki 18:35  has quit 18:38  has quit 18:47  has quit 18:49  has quit 18:56  has joined #xwiki 19:08  has quit 19:23  has quit 19:25  has joined #xwiki 19:39  has joined #xwiki 19:39  has quit 19:40  has joined #xwiki 19:40  has quit 20:09  has quit 20:15  has quit 20:27  has quit 20:38  has quit 20:51  has joined #xwiki 20:52  has quit 21:30  has joined #xwiki 21:48  has joined #xwiki 22:07  has quit 22:16  has joined #xwiki 23:19  has quit 23:22  has quit 23:24  has joined #xwiki
